oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ service, 1995 May 6
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Vieo recording of a service that opens with singing lead by Jamie Coots followed by serpant handing by Carl Porter, Bill Pelfrey, and Junior McCormick amidst dancing by Shade Miller and Billy Lemming among others. Handling is followed by testimony from Junior McCormick. Carl Porter and Billy Lemming drink strychnine after which congregants sing, dance, and lay hands on one another.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Imposition of hands; Singing -- Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Coots, Jamie, (Gregory James), 1971-2014; Kimbrough, David L., 1951-; Lemming, Billy; McCormick, Junior; Miller, Shade; Pelfry, Bill; Porter, Carl
Church of the Lord Jesus Christ (Kingston, Ga.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
